originalText.text: I get my dermatology issues addressed by Dr. Kling. Dr. Kling is very pleasant and professional. Every issue I bring to Dr. Kling is met with understanding, kindness and compassion, including insurance issues that are very confusing especially deductibles, co-pays and co-insurance.  His front desk is able to explain how it works that makes it easy to understand.  The best part is, Dr. Kling is very attentive about my skin issues and always has good advice and treatments that really work.  I am also always able to get results. My experience with Dr. Kling  is always pleasant, enjoyable and relaxing and puts you at ease.  I trust Dr. Kling and I will return and refer friends and family to him.

originalText.text:
Dr. Kling has been my family’s dermatologist for over 25 years.  That should say enough!  He is knowledgeable, thorough, communicative and a nice person.  He takes the time to answer your questions, explain conditions and treatments and address your concerns.  He was great putting my kids at ease when they were young and felt nervous.
On a personal level, he always has a moment to ask about you and your family so you feel like you’re more than a number in the day’s schedule – a rarity these days.
His staff is friendly and courteous and there is rarely a long wait to see him.

text.text:

He takes the time to answer your questions, explain conditions and treatments and address your concerns.  He was great putting my kids at ease when they were young and felt nervous.

His staff is friendly and courteous and there is rarely a long wait to see him.

originalText.text:
Dr. Kling does not honor the time of his appointments.  I had a noon appt and with no acknowledgement by him of his delays as he came in and out of exam rooms with 2 different patients who had gone in while I was waiting.

At 1:00 I asked for a refund from Jaclyn (lovely and capable) at the front desk.

I told him that amount of waiting time is inexcusable since with proper notice from his very capable staff, I could have rescheduled.

He remarked, “ My attention is with the patient as it should be”.  Somehow he seemed to forget both respect and other patients.  I would not recommend.

originalText.text:
When I had terrible itching and rashes along my hands and neck, my Primary Care physician couldn't really pinpoint it and just gave me a prescription for everything and anything.
Afterward, I decided to go to Dr. Kling for a second opinion and he really felt strongly it was a case of poison ivy, at which point i remembered that I indeed was messing around in an unfamiliar garden 2 days previous.
He prescribed medicine and gave me a magical dose of something on the spot.
I got instant relief and fast curing from there on.
Since then, I've gone to him for removal of moles and other growths. All healed quickly and no scarring whatsoever, even on my eyelid!!

He's no-nonsense and good at what he does. Also accepts lots of insurance plans as I've changed a few times over the years.
I'm not an easy customer but I have to give credit where it is due. Since then, I've sent my folks for all sorts of things and they are very pleased as well. Parents are an even tougher pair of customers!!

Howard

originalText.text: Dr. Kling is an excellent doctor who truly cares about his patients. Not only has Dr. Kling been treating me for 20 years, he also treats teenagers from my program free of charge. This is a doctor who understands the importance of getting care even if you can't afford it. There should be more doctors like him.
